;;S;;ome徒步旅行者认为最后一英里是最难的：所有的水泡和累积的疼痛在最后减缓了进展。其他人发誓这是最简单的，因为终点线就在眼前。对于美联储来说，将通胀率拉回到 2% 目标的最后一英里既容易又困难。从某种意义上说，这很容易，因为央行已经八个月没有调整利率，而是让之前的紧缩政策发挥作用。很难，因为等待通胀消退的时间感觉相当漫长。

;;
;;

;价格压力的缓慢缓解和美国持续的经济活力引发了关于美联储是否可能因此在反通胀旅程的最后一英里制定更加激进的方针的争论。政策制定者已电报称，他们今年将降息三个四分之一个百分点。但自那以后，一些重要的通胀指标似乎一直停留在 3-4% 左右，而失业率则保持在 4% 以下。因此，3 月 20 日结束的货币政策会议面临的一个大问题是，美联储是否可能将降息预期削减至两次。最终，央行（或者更准确地说，是其利率制定委员会中票数中位数的成员）选择维持 2024 年三次降息的预期，但将 2025 年的预测从 2025 年下调至三次。四.

;
;

;通胀指标的重大差距有助于解释美联储坚持今年计划的理由。对通货膨胀持续存在的担忧很大程度上源于最近的消费者价格指数读数。剔除波动性较大的食品和能源成本后，“核心”CPI 在 2022 年大部分时间和 2023 年初有所放缓，但自去年 6 月以来增速有所加快。 1 月和 2 月，通胀率均以约 0.4% 的月度涨幅，如果这一增速持续一整年，将导致年度通胀率达到 5% 左右，这对于美联储来说太高了。在这种情况下，美国央行官员担心的不是降息，而是是否恢复加息。

;

;然而，尽管投资者和评论员倾向于强调<小>;CPI;，<小>;;在很大程度上是因为它是每个月的第一个通胀数据点，央行的重点是一个单独的指标：个人消费支出价格指数，几周后就会出来。核心;PCE;价格表现较好。尽管它们在一月份升温，但过去半年的年化增速与美联储 2% 的通胀目标完全一致。这有助于让央行官员相信他们可以相对较快地开始降息。

;是什么导致;CPI;-;PCE;差异？ ;CPI;更加刚性，其组成部分每年都会调整； ;PCE;实际上每个月都会调整，例如反映消费者是否用更便宜的苹果替代更贵的橙子。随着时间的推移，这会导致;PCE;价格增长略有下降。不同的权重今年也产生了很大的影响。住房约占;CPI ;篮子的三分之一，但仅占;PCE ;的15%，而居高不下的租金使;CPI ;持续走高。还有其他差异。例如，根据一组固定航线的价格，机票价格推高了 2 月份的;CPI;。考虑实际飞行距离的 ;PCE; 较低。

;美联储的另一个问题是它希望最终走向何方。在理想的世界中，央行官员将引导充分就业、稳定通胀的经济达到所谓的中性利率，即货币政策既不扩张也不紧缩的水平。事实上，尽管无法观察到中性利率，但美联储仍试图以中性利率为目标，其政策制定者每季度都会写下他们的估计。自 2019 年以来，他们的实际预测中位数为 0.5%（即联邦基金利率为 2.5%，;个人消费支出;通胀率为 2%）。

;

;这种情况已经改变，尽管是难以察觉的。美联储新的长期利率预测中值小幅上调至 2.6%，意味着实际中性利率为 0.6%。这听起来可能是一个微不足道的学术差异。但这是央行思考大流行后增长的核心，特别是它是否认为利率应该持续走高，以避免经济过热，这可能是由于生产率提高或政府过度支出造成的。官员们似乎正在倾向于这种观点，尽管鲍威尔先生反对根据长期利率的上升趋势得出任何结论。

;;;;阿纳姆伯格斯动物园的年轻雄性黑猩猩;又打起来了。他们绕着岛屿奔跑，露出牙齿，尖叫着。特别是其中有两个人一直在战斗，直到一个人最终获胜，另一个人失败。最后，他们显然在生闷气，高高地站在同一棵树上相距甚远的树枝上。然后，年轻的弗朗斯·德瓦尔（Frans de Waal）正在观察他们的战争以完成他的论文，他看到了一些令人惊讶的事情。一个人向另一个人伸出了手，仿佛在说：“我们和解吧。”一分钟后，他们就荡到了树的主叉处，在那里拥抱并亲吻。

;

;他毫不犹豫地称此为那是什么：和解。更重要的是，如果团队想要凝聚力和生存下去，这一点至关重要。然而，这个词激怒了他的导师。在 20 世纪 70 年代中期，研究灵长类动物主要是记录暴力、攻击性和自私。这些就是人类应该超越的“动物本能”。动物没有感情或理解力让过去的事就让它过去吧。在黑猩猩岛上，一切都是牙齿和爪子。

;
;
;
;
;
;

;但是 de Waal 博士看到了那只手伸出来，这永远改变了他的工作。他决定向科学怀疑论者提供他们所需的证据——数百次实验、数小时的视频和大量数据——以证明人类感受到的每一种情感，其他灵长类动物也能感受到。当他看着黑猩猩的眼睛时，他的目光充满了聪明和自信。当达尔文看到被挠痒痒的黑猩猩大笑时，他也有同样的感觉，就像他的孩子们一样。他最狭隘的对手是 20 世纪的行为主义者，他们将动物简化为机器，将动物的笑声简化为“喘息声”。

;

;几十年来，他主要在佐治亚州埃默里大学担任灵长类动物行为学教授，并用他面无表情的荷兰方式发表充满笑话的;TED;演讲，将他的想法融入了科学主流。他仔细地选择了自己的物种：黑猩猩、倭黑猩猩和卷尾猴，前两种与人类的 ;DNA; 构成仅相差 1.5%。他对黑猩猩很熟悉，因为在动物园工作之前，他曾与两只住在奈梅亨大学心理学系的黑猩猩成为朋友。倭黑猩猩引起了他的兴趣，因为它们几乎没有黑猩猩所承认的攻击性，而且几乎一直都很和平，可以做爱，而不是战争。 （他自己也有点嬉皮士的气质，在 20 世纪 70 年代几乎和倭黑猩猩一样毛茸茸的，他对此很感兴趣。）如果他能让人们相信，他们更好的本能——利他主义、合作、缔造和平——就像他们与生俱来的那样，会怎么样？暴力也是“动物”？

;

;公平概念是一个很好的例子。其他灵长类动物也要求平等的待遇和奖励，他的证据被记录在视频中，并迅速传播开来。两只卷尾猴被关在相邻的笼子里，并被赋予相同的任务，将石头交给研究人员。起初，两人都得到了一片水黄瓜作为奖励。但随后有人得到了一颗葡萄的奖励。被轻视的猴子注意到了，感到不安。当这种情况再次发生时，猴子发疯了，把它的一片黄瓜扔出笼子，摇动栅栏，并竭尽全力从外面抓起那碗葡萄。就在那里。 /div>;

;政治是他的臣民在以惊人的微妙方式上表现出色的领域。野蛮行为在黑猩猩领导力竞争中没有发挥作用。相反，他们通过赠送食物或某些女性的恩惠来达成交易并培养联盟。他指出，群体中的雄性领袖并不总是最大或最强的，但最擅长策划。简而言之，黑猩猩马基雅维利。他在《黑猩猩政治》（Chimpanzee Politics）（1982年）中列出了所有这些，这是他写的关于灵长类动物行为的17本流行书中的第一本，这是众议院繁重的演讲者纽特·金里奇（Newt Gingrich）宣布的，所有国会新生都应阅读。

;

;超越合作，他喜欢通过展示两个黑猩猩拖着一个沉重的盒子来证明自己不能独自移动，他还看到了纯粹的利他主义的实例：族长的黑猩猩便士，太老了，无法走路，帮助围墙，越过其他女性，或者一群人进入一棵树，或在舔一名击败战士的伤口的男性中。他看到雄性在雌性不在时照顾孩子，甚至放慢穿过森林的步伐，让小家伙跟上。同性性行为很常见，什么都可以。不存在不容忍现象。也许最动人的是一位名为Kuni的女性BONOBO的明显同理心，她发现一只受伤的鸟，爬到了最高的树的顶部，并散开了翅膀以鼓励它飞行。

;此类灵长类动物是否可以具有道德上的良心，更不用说道德确定性了。他们和人类之间的主要区别在于，人类编造故事，比如伊索寓言，来证明他们的行为合理。有了这样的理由，他们经常试图将自己的道德价值观强加给不同的民族。其他灵长类动物没有尝试，通常仅显示外部的粗糙一面。

;When Hong Kong was handed back to China by the British in 1997 it was given a mini-constitution, called the Basic Law, and promised “a high degree of autonomy” under the “one country, two systems” model.居民获得了大陆华人无法享有的自由和公民自由。然而该文件的第 23 条却笼罩着这座城市。它要求香港通过国家安全立法，许多人担心这会改变其性质。 When the government tried to push through such a measure in 2003 it sparked large protests and the city's leaders backed down.

;

;The ease with which the measure passed this time around is indicative of just how much has changed in Hong Kong.近年来，在中央政府的要求下，对言论、新闻媒体、书籍和文化的控制变得更加令人窒息。旧的安全法已经阻止了大多数怀有政治不满的人试图挑战政府。新的增加了这种恐惧的气氛。 No big protests are expected in the coming days.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;But the speed with which the government moved to pass Article 23 has raised eyebrows.它于1月30日揭晓。随后进行了一次异常简短的公众咨询，并于 2 月 28 日结束。该法案随后迅速通过立法会。一些人认为，这样做的目的是为了让外国观察家措手不及，从而避免受到批评。尽管如此，在委员会阶段审查该法案的立法者仍预计会产生影响。 Bracing for sanctions imposed by Western governments, they have reportedly begun referring to themselves as “martyrs”.

;

;Hong Kong officials seem to believe any sacrifice would be worth it.他们认为原来的安全法有助于给这座城市带来和平与繁荣，并认为新的法律也会产生类似的积极影响。李显龙称这一时刻是“历史性的”，并补充说政府“辜负了国家的信任，没有让中央政府失望”。 If the people of Hong Kong disagree, they will have to say so quietly.;■;

;;“W;;e are genuinely; very satisfied,” declared President Javier Milei of Argentina on local radio, after inflation in February fell more than expected to 13%.然而，这是每月的数字。去年这一比例加起来达到了 276%，为全球最高。每年仅 8% 的通货膨胀率已经让富裕国家的政局感到不安。 That Mr Milei, with some justification, saw fit to celebrate 13% monthly inflation shows what an utter economic mess he inherited, and how much he has left to do to fix it.

;

;Mr Milei, an irascible outsider and ;self-described “anarcho-capitalist”;, campaigned while brandishing a chainsaw and promising to slash spending. 12 月 10 日，他接管了一个臃肿的国家，通过印钞来筹集巨额预算赤字。通货膨胀猖獗；下水道中比索的价值。 The government owed $263bn to foreign creditors, including $43bn to the ;IMF;, but had no dollars whatsoever. Like many Argentine governments, the previous one spent far beyond its means trying to buy popularity, while inventing increasingly absurd temporary macroeconomic fixes (such as heavy price controls) to keep the economy wobbling along.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Mr Milei is trying to steer the country down a dangerously narrow path, discarding those dodgy fixes as he goes.他的基本政治问题是，猛烈攻击建制派和普通政客，他称之为“种姓”的群体，是他受欢迎的支柱。然而，由于其成员在国会中占主导地位，他需要来自它的一些支持来实施深入的改革。 But if he makes too many deals with it he risks his outsider status and thus some popular backing—his only real political asset.

;

;After 100 days he can boast of real economic success.尽管他缺乏国会的支持，但他的受欢迎程度仍在持续上升。如果他能够在明年年底的中期选举之前让公众保持支持，他就可以极大地增强自己的影响力，从而增强他重塑阿根廷经济的能力。但阿根廷人已经深受其苦，可能会更早地抛弃他。 That would be a blow to radical reformers worldwide.

;

;Start with his economic successes.为了表明不会再印钞，米莱先生痴迷于实现预算盈余，这意味着政府征税超过支出。 He says he will achieve a surplus (before interest payments) this year of 2% of ;GDP;, a huge change from a 3% deficit last year.一月和二月，政府均实现了月度盈余，这是十多年来的首次。为此，它在一定程度上使用了米莱先生的电锯：削减能源和交通补贴、向各省的转移支付和资本支出。 It also relied on another tool;: la licuadora;, the blender. Raising spending by less than inflation is a reduction in real terms, known in Argentina as ;licuación;. Spending on contributory pensions, the single biggest budget item, fell almost 40% in real terms compared with the first two months of last year.

;

;政府还采取了另外两项重大举措。 12月，比索贬值超过50%，部分缩小了官方汇率与黑市汇率之间的差距。但这推高了通货膨胀。 12 月份的降息也是如此。通常，央行会提高利率来对抗通货膨胀。该银行的理由是，降息将减少其债券的利息支付，从而减少流通量。 12 月份通货膨胀率最初飙升至 26%。 That hurt Argentines, but supercharged Mr Milei's blender.

;;

;Means matter

;

;The costs, however, are brutal.受通货膨胀的影响，估计有 50% 的阿根廷人陷入贫困，高于去年 9 月的 38%。另一家咨询公司 Invecq 计算出，按实际价值计算，工资已经倒退了 20 年。处方药的购买量下降了 7%。药房总销售额下降 46%。 1月份中小型企业的销量同比下降近30%。 The economy will shrink 4% this year, reckons Barclays, a bank.

;

;Such hardship can become dangerous for presidents, literally. 2001年，由于担心暴力抗议者，有人乘坐直升机逃离了总统办公场所卡萨罗萨达(Casa Rosada)。然而，尽管经济困难重重，米莱先生的支持率仍然非常高，达到 50% 左右。 This is mostly because he has succeeded in blaming the caste for putting Argentina in this mess.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Still, Mr Milei's first 100 days are marked by serious problems.除了痛苦之外，经济计划还充满了不确定性。其中一项风险是汇率。为了减缓通货膨胀，政府每月将比索贬值 2%。 Yet with monthly inflation much higher than 2% that is probably less than what is necessary. Alas, a faster crawl or sudden sharp devaluation would spark more inflation.

;

;Argentina will inevitably soon have to switch to a new monetary and foreign-exchange regime.问题是何时以及针对什么政权。米雷先生的计划是取消资本管制并统一汇率。但政府会推出正统的比索货币计划，还是会尝试将经济美元化？自上任以来，米雷先生关于美元化的竞选承诺变得模糊。政府现在更多地谈论“货币竞争”（允许以美元或比索进行交易）。然而，当被问及是否不考虑美元化时，财政部长巴勃罗·基尔诺 (Pablo Quirno) 模棱两可。他说，美元化是“基本上埋葬[货币]印刷机的一种方式”。这“更多的是道德讨论”。这种不确定性已经引起了投资者的不安。 The government has also hinted that it will seek a new ;IMF; programme, perhaps worth $15bn, but that too may be difficult without clearer plans.

;

;Another problem is that reducing inflation by forcing a recession will be painful.布宜诺斯艾利斯托尔夸托迪特拉大学的爱德华多·利维·耶亚蒂表示：“在一个以经济衰退为货币政策关键因素的国家进行投资没有吸引力。” What's more, he adds, when growth returns inflation could accelerate.

;

;Last, these fiscal surpluses may prove hard to sustain. 2 月份的盈余已经小于 1 月份，经济衰退正在严重打击税收收入。其中一大节省是能源补贴，但其中大部分只是推迟，而不是取消。省长们对削减转移支付表示愤怒，包括在法庭上抗议。 Although the current pension formula is helping the government reduce spending, as inflation falls it will eventually have the opposite effect.

;

;The politics have been rockiest 。米雷先生仍然很受欢迎，但他的联盟没有州长，并且在众议院仅占 15% 的席位。他于 12 月底向国会提交了一份包含 664 条文章的庞大综合法案，但遭到了拆散。最终他撤回了，这是一场惨败。缺乏优先顺序也会造成伤害。放松捕鱼许可证管制和关闭国家戏剧学院与养老金改革无关。 Yet all these and more were bundled together, slowing the bill down and providing countless reasons to vote against it.

;

;An earlier, sprawling presidential decree有同样的问题。它从重要的劳动力市场放松管制延伸到次要的，允许银行对信用卡债务收取更多利息。 3 月 14 日，该法令在参议院被否决，加深了人们对米莱先生在政治上脆弱的担忧。 (The decree will remain in force unless the lower chamber also votes against it.) His labour reforms and attempts to defang unions are also tied up in the courts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Mr Milei has made simple errors, too.本月，反对派强调了一项由米莱签署的法令，其中包括将他的工资提高 48%——对于财政电锯的使用者来说，这是一个可怕的形象。 He said the pay rise was the result of a past president's decree, rapidly reversed it and fired his labour secretary.

;

;In the next 100 days the politics and economics will entwine.政府希望至少一个百分点的财政整顿来自于恢复所得税和其他税收改革。养老金公式也迫切需要更新。这一切都需要国会的批准。米雷先生还需要在国会取得成功，让投资者相信他有足够的盟友来避免或至少生存未来的抗议和政治混乱。他离弹劾还很远。 “There are so many bombs ticking,” says Sebastián Mazzuca of Johns Hopkins University.

;

;He appears to be aware of the problem. 3 月 1 日，他打开了围绕“五月公约”（一套自由市场原则）进行谈判的窗口。随后，他的内政部长会见了影响国会的有权有势的省长。他们中的许多人显得有些平静。一项协议可能涉及恢复一些对各省的转移支付，并恢复所得税（双方都希望但没有人愿意承认这样做），以换取向总统授予一些紧急经济权力、养老金改革以及采矿和能源放松管制。 Much else will be parked.

;

;Aesthetics of obstinance

;

;Yet it is unclear if that will be enough for Mr Milei, who still boasts he “will not cede a millimetre” on fiscal plans, and who called the senators who voted against his decree “enemies of society”.基尔诺先生声称，“无论如何”，政府都将实现其财政目标。他威胁说，如果国会阻止税收改革，政府可能会继续扣留向各省的转移支付以弥补差额。 That would be explosive.

;

;Mr Milei's fate depends on two unknowns.阿根廷人在转向他之前能承受多少经济痛苦？他能否获得足够快的经济进步所需的政治支持，以阻止整个事情崩溃？目前迹象还算积极。如果成功，他可能会在明年的中期选举中占据主导地位。然而，如果他的民调支持率首先下降，他的竞争对手肯定会挥舞着自己的电锯——反对他的计划。 And then they will try to throw his whole presidency into the blender.;■;

; https://www.economist.com/the-americas/2024/03/19/after-100-brutal-days-javier-milei-has-markets-beling /内容/fm1f9fvf9rck7k6rfahocatnb1a6te1n Tue, 19 Mar 2024 18:56:53 GMT阿根廷 五张图表比较了民主党和共和党在创造就业方面的情况

;;F;;ROM TIME; to time a chart circulates showing that virtually every job new in America over the past 35 years was created under a Democratic president (see chart 1).通常情况下，这张图表会像病毒一样传播，民主党人非常乐意吹嘘他们创造就业机会的能力。 Since 1989 a mere 1.3m jobs have been created in net terms with Republicans in the Oval Office—despite the party's reputation for being more business-friendly.民主党执政后，净增加了 4940 万个就业岗位。从狭义的定义来看——仅考虑每月的就业数据——该图表确实是准确的。 But a closer look at the data paints a different picture, showing a less marked contrast.

;;
;;;
;

;Start with a simple point. It would be astonishing if the parties' shifting fortunes truly led to such wildly different outcomes, almost overnight, for the American economy. Many things feed into growth trends that have only a scant connection to whoever is living in the White House—from the business cycle to tech innovations and Federal Reserve decisions to the global economy. At a minimum several adjustments to the jobs data are needed to make a fairer comparison.

;
;;
;

;Our first adjustment is to the period of time. Beginning with the presidency of George HW Bush in 1989 skews the outcome, since it omits America's job performance under Ronald Reagan, who presided over a boom in the 1980s.将美国现代经济趋势追溯到 20 世纪 70 年代末和吉米·卡特的一届总统任期更为公平（见图 2）。 This also covers a period during which Republican and Democratic parties were in the White House for roughly equal amounts of time, 24 years each. During this time Republican presidents have been in power for the creation of 17m jobs, whereas Democrats have been there for 60m. That is still a big gap (about 3.5 times as many jobs were created under Democrats as under Republicans) but not as large as the chasm that appears if the analysis starts in 1989 (a ratio of 39 to one).

;;;

;Another objection to the first chart is that dumb luck accounts for much of the difference (see chart 3). George W. Bush caused neither the dot-com bust of the early 2000s nor the global financial crisis of 2007-09, but they book-ended his presidency. Both destroyed millions of jobs. The elder Bush, for his part, complained—with some justification—that an over-hawkish Fed undermined the economy while he was in the White House. And Donald Trump is not to blame for massive job losses at the height of the covid-19 pandemic. Moreover, after several of the downturns that weighed on Republican job figures, big rebounds flattered Democratic totals.

;
;;
;

;A better way to examine differences is to look at the median month for job creation in each presidency, thereby eliminating any unusually weak or strong期间。 Analysed this way, Reagan and Mr Trump narrowly beat Barack Obama, though both trail far behind Joe Biden's record to date (see chart 4). On the whole Democratic presidents still do better than Republicans do, but the margin is greatly reduced (to about two to one).

;
;;
;

;Another sensible adjustment to evaluating the job performance under each president is to apply a one-year lag. The logic here is that it takes a while for presidents to get their feet under the Resolute desk and to get to work on the policies—from executive orders to legislation—that define their legacies. Mr Trump signed his sweeping tax cuts into law near the end of his first year in office. Mr Biden got off to a quicker start with a covid-recovery stimulus. But his other big acts, including an infrastructure-investment package, took longer to pass. And companies, individuals and investors need even more time to digest policy shifts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Looking at median monthly job creation in each presidency, lagged by one year, Mr Biden holds on to the top spot. But Mr Trump is nipping at his heels in second place and Reagan comes in third. In aggregate Democrats still outperform Republicans, but once again the margin is much smaller than before: 205,000 median monthly jobs for Democrats versus 150,000 for Republicans (see chart 5). That is still around 40% more for Democrats—an appreciable gap. But in an economy as big and diverse as America's, with so many exogenous variables at play, it would be a stretch to ascribe that difference to the occupant of the White House. Still, one thing is clear: Republicans are far off base when they brand their opponents as job killers.;■;

;;
;;

;;F;;ROM TIME; to time a chart circulates showing that virtually every job new in America over the past 35 years was created under a Democratic president (see chart 1).通常情况下，这张图表会像病毒一样传播，民主党人非常乐意吹嘘他们创造就业机会的能力。 Since 1989 a mere 1.3m jobs have been created in net terms with Republicans in the Oval Office—despite the party's reputation for being more business-friendly.民主党执政后，净增加了 4940 万个就业岗位。从狭义的定义来看——仅考虑每月的就业数据——该图表确实是准确的。 But a closer look at the data paints a different picture, showing a less marked contrast.

;;
;;;
;

;Start with a simple point. It would be astonishing if the parties' shifting fortunes truly led to such wildly different outcomes, almost overnight, for the American economy. Many things feed into growth trends that have only a scant connection to whoever is living in the White House—from the business cycle to tech innovations and Federal Reserve decisions to the global economy. At a minimum several adjustments to the jobs data are needed to make a fairer comparison.

;
;;
;

;Our first adjustment is to the period of time. Beginning with the presidency of George HW Bush in 1989 skews the outcome, since it omits America's job performance under Ronald Reagan, who presided over a boom in the 1980s.将美国现代经济趋势追溯到 20 世纪 70 年代末和吉米·卡特的一届总统任期更为公平（见图 2）。 This also covers a period during which Republican and Democratic parties were in the White House for roughly equal amounts of time, 24 years each. During this time Republican presidents have been in power for the creation of 17m jobs, whereas Democrats have been there for 60m. That is still a big gap (about 3.5 times as many jobs were created under Democrats as under Republicans) but not as large as the chasm that appears if the analysis starts in 1989 (a ratio of 39 to one).

;;;

;Another objection to the first chart is that dumb luck accounts for much of the difference (see chart 3). George W. Bush caused neither the dot-com bust of the early 2000s nor the global financial crisis of 2007-09, but they book-ended his presidency. Both destroyed millions of jobs. The elder Bush, for his part, complained—with some justification—that an over-hawkish Fed undermined the economy while he was in the White House. And Donald Trump is not to blame for massive job losses at the height of the covid-19 pandemic. Moreover, after several of the downturns that weighed on Republican job figures, big rebounds flattered Democratic totals.

;
;;
;

;A better way to examine differences is to look at the median month for job creation in each presidency, thereby eliminating any unusually weak or strong期间。 Analysed this way, Reagan and Mr Trump narrowly beat Barack Obama, though both trail far behind Joe Biden's record to date (see chart 4). On the whole Democratic presidents still do better than Republicans do, but the margin is greatly reduced (to about two to one).

;
;;
;

;Another sensible adjustment to evaluating the job performance under each president is to apply a one-year lag. The logic here is that it takes a while for presidents to get their feet under the Resolute desk and to get to work on the policies—from executive orders to legislation—that define their legacies. Mr Trump signed his sweeping tax cuts into law near the end of his first year in office. Mr Biden got off to a quicker start with a covid-recovery stimulus. But his other big acts, including an infrastructure-investment package, took longer to pass. And companies, individuals and investors need even more time to digest policy shifts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Looking at median monthly job creation in each presidency, lagged by one year, Mr Biden holds on to the top spot. But Mr Trump is nipping at his heels in second place and Reagan comes in third. In aggregate Democrats still outperform Republicans, but once again the margin is much smaller than before: 205,000 median monthly jobs for Democrats versus 150,000 for Republicans (see chart 5). That is still around 40% more for Democrats—an appreciable gap. But in an economy as big and diverse as America's, with so many exogenous variables at play, it would be a stretch to ascribe that difference to the occupant of the White House. Still, one thing is clear: Republicans are far off base when they brand their opponents as job killers.;■;

;;F;;or; ;most; of this century it has looked as if the world's economy was turning Japanese, with low growth, below-target inflation and rock-bottom interest rates.今天的问题是日本将在多大程度上与世界其他国家相似。 On March 19th the Bank of Japan ;raised interest rates; for the first time since 2007, after inflation seemed at last to have become entrenched.银行余额的利息先前设定为负 0.1%，现在将增加 0.1%。 The central bank, under its relatively new governor, Ueda Kazuo (pictured), also scrapped its policy of yield-curve control, which capped long-term bond yields at 1%. ;
;

;Yet it would be wrong to conclude that Japan is de-Japanifying. More important than an economy's nominal attributes such as inflation, headline interest rates and stockmarket growth are its real, structural features.如果你看看基本面，即使利率上升也并不像看上去的那样。日本央行认为目前即将实现的2%通胀目标比截至2021年底的十年间平均通胀率高出1.4个百分点。预期通胀上升1.4个百分点，远超预期通胀0.2个百分点因此，实际利率是下降而不是上升。 Moreover, the bank made clear in its statement on March 19th that it expected to maintain “accommodative” financial conditions and would keep buying some bonds.

;

;Rock-bottom real rates reflect the fact that Japan's elderly population—30% are over 65—has abundant savings.公司很难将这些资金投入生产，因为人口减少的经济体对资本投资的兴趣较低。 Japan's demography and its unwillingness to allow much immigration also constrain its growth. ;

;A final factor is Japan's enduring public indebtedness. The debt-to-;GDP; ratio is 255% in gross terms, or 159% after netting off the government's financial assets;这两项指标都是发达国家中最高的。即使利率较低，近 9% 的政府预算都花在了债务利息上。 Japan could not withstand a monetary tightening anything like as severe as the one in America, where rates have reached 5.25-5.5%.

;

;Long before they got to such levels in Japan, the government would have to reduce its deficit, which was 5.6% of ;GDP; in 2023. The economy would cool from fiscal belt-tightening, not higher rates.对于货币政策，就像对于增长一样，只有一条路可以让日本不再与众不同：如果世界其他国家也效仿它。 ;■;

;;I;; GREW UP; in an India that was a proud liberal democracy saddled with an illiberal, over-regulated economy that micro-managed private enterprise.我们称之为许可证管理。我在一家生产 Vicks VapoRub 的公司工作。有一年，流感流行，维克斯的销量猛增。年底，政府发出传票，声称我的公司违反了法律：销量超过了我们许可证中授权的维克斯产量。 It was a criminal offence, we were told.

;

;I was asked to appear at a hearing before a government official.我解释说，疫情造成了额外的需求；我们只是在尽我们的职责，保持商店货架上的库存。但官员宣布我们有罪，并宣布法律现在将按其程序进行。 As I got up to leave, I asked the official to imagine how our country would look to the world when news broke that our government had punished someone for alleviating the misery of millions during an epidemic.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;In the end, the government quietly dropped the case.但我放弃了社会主义，成为一名古典自由主义者，并加入了自由派斯瓦坦特拉党。自由主义为我提供了一种倡导人类进步的哲学，这种进步并不指望它仅仅来自国家。 I learned to believe in the liberal virtues of openness, mutual respect and tolerance of others' views.

;

;India had to wait until the liberalisation of 1991 to win its economic freedom, after sacrificing two generations to missed opportunities.我写了一本书《不受约束的印度》，根据改革预测印度的崛起。印度有义务成为世界上增长第二快的大型经济体，在未来 30 年中以年均近 6% 的速度增长，使 4 亿人摆脱贫困，并将中产阶级从人口的 10% 扩大到 30% .

;

;But just when everything seemed to be going well, democracy began to weaken.过去十年见证了身份政治、多数主义、印度教民族主义和伊斯兰恐惧症的兴起。批评者被压制，社交媒体上的言论已成为右翼的武器。 The atmosphere of hate has damaged India's cherished secular ideal of ;sarva dharma samabhava, ;respect for all religions. Although there has been no communal riot on the same scale as those in Gujarat in 2002 or in Delhi in 1984, there have been many localised incidents of violence, not least against Muslims suspected of selling beef.

;

;Today, Indian liberals like me face a dilemma: not only do we have no one to vote for, but even if we did they would be unelectable.感觉就像一条孤独的路。 I lost my friends on the right when I publicly condemned the riots in Gujarat and criticised the banknote demonetisation in 2016 by the government, led then, as now, by the Bharatiya Janata Party (;BJP;). I lost my friends on the left when I voted for the ;BJP; in 2014.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Sadly, I am the man in the middle, disappointed with both sides.我不能投票支持印度人民党的独裁、身份政治。但我也不相信反对党国大党的再分配、民粹主义和国家主义经济学，他们随时准备在增长和公平之间做出错误的权衡。 Nor do I have much faith in the ;INDIA; alliance of opposition parties that was formed last year with Congress at its centre.

;

;Lamentably, in the past ten years the opposition has not come up with a single new idea to deal with most of India's biggest issues: jobs, air quality, education and health care.向卡纳塔克邦的妇女发放零用钱或在德里免费乘坐公交车并不能解决问题。 The ;INDIA; alliance is incapable of doing the heavy lifting to take the economy to the next level.

;

;India may have become a fast-growing economy but it has still not created enough jobs.它未能引发工业革命。 Manufacturing accounts for only 17% of ;GDP; and India punches well below its weight when it comes to exports of industrial goods. It needs to find more productive jobs for the 45% of its workers stuck in agriculture.

;

;But how? It will require major reforms, including three that Narendra Modi's ;BJP; government tried but failed to enact because of the lack of opposition support: simplifying the acquisition of land for industrial purposes;修改严格的劳动法，使公司能够灵活地雇用和解雇工人，同时保护他们免受剥削；彻底修改农业法以提高生产力。 I trust the ;BJP; to execute these reforms far more than the opposition—though the BJP, while a party of modernisation, is not an ideological reformer.

;

;Liberals are partly to blame for this unhappy state of affairs.原因之一是印度的自由主义仍然是精英事业：印度教民族主义的兴起部分是对英语精英的反抗。另一个原因是，没有一个自由派政治领袖与传统进行过认真的对话。唉，圣雄甘地死得太早了。 He had been able to translate the liberal ideas of liberty and equality into the civilisational language of ;dharma;—his moral principles—and thus capture the hearts and minds of the masses.

;

;And yet, despite this gloomy situation, I remain optimistic about liberalism's future in India.印度的文明气质是开放、包容、自由的。在这片拥有 3.3 亿众神的土地上，没有一个神能够感到嫉妒，而且人们好争论，狭隘的印度教民族主义不可能有很长的保质期。 Liberalism will win out in the end.;■;
